author: kaz
msg: Modified the DVSL stylesheet to only generate a report if unit tests
exist.  If no unit tests exist, then the junit-report displays a simple
message indicating no unit tests existed.

author: kaz
msg: Maven now produces standard navigation links for all of its documents.
These links are appended after the user's xdocs/project.xml file has
been parsed in a section called "Maven Generated Docs".  There are links
to the mailing lists, developers, dependencies, metrics, junit report,
xref source, and javadocs.  Using Maven is now even easier because the
links are automatically added to a project's pages.
I've modified Maven's xdocs/project.xml file and removed the links to
any auto-generated documentation because the standard navigation links
(describe above) will add them to the site automatically.

author: kaz
msg: Removing the hard-coded reference to the 'docs' directory.

author: jvanzyl
msg: Get rid of the test-reports directory in the 'clean' target.

author: kaz
msg: Moving the location where the images are copied to be more consistent
with the rest of the process.  This produces a build system that can be
used immediately without having to actually call the 'dist' target
later.
